question.title: Will Coca-Cola recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Danone recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Danone announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. question.title: Will both Coca-Cola and Danone recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, both Coca-Cola and Danone announce a recall of any of their products due to metal contamination. Each recall must be officially confirmed by the respective company (Coca-Cola or Danone) or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If either company does not announce such a recall within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Land O'Frost issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.body:

The recall for each company must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If both companies do not announce such recalls meeting these criteria by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania hold a referendum on renewable energy initiatives by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts an official public referendum specifically focused on implementing renewable energy initiatives in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on renewable energy initiatives.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum occurs or is completed by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Proposed referendums that have not been officially conducted by the resolution date do not count for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Illinois holds a referendum on healthcare reform, and (b) Pennsylvania holds a referendum on renewable energy initiatives?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur by August 31, 2024:

The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. (b) Pennsylvania conducts an official public referendum specifically focused on implementing renewable energy initiatives. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania, with the primary focus on renewable energy initiatives. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. Proposed referendums that have not been officially conducted by the resolution date do not count for a YES resolution.

If both (a) and (b) occur by the specified date, this question will resolve as YES. If either (a) or (b) does not occur, it will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Google's AI assistant be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the CMA announce completion of a major digital advertising practices investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) of the UK officially announces the completion of its investigation into digital advertising practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official CMA announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the CMA does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

Both conditions must be satisfied for the question to resolve as YES.

question.title: Will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for freight train operations by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations. The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for freight train operations. If no such system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system does not specifically target schedule predictability for freight train operations, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Union Pacific reach a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific and the union representing train conductors publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors. The agreement must be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If no such agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced agreement does not specifically address work schedule predictability, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

question.title: Will the headquarters of a major cybersecurity company be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in New York City by August 2024?

question.title: Will California hold a referendum on gun control measures by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on gun control measures. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address gun control, either proposing to introduce new regulations or to relax existing ones. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on gun control does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Arkansas Senate pass a total abortion ban by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Arkansas Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. For the purpose of this question, a 'total abortion ban' refers to legislation that prohibits all or nearly all abortions, with possible exceptions only for cases involving rape, incest, or threat to the mother's life. The passage of such legislation must be confirmed through official Arkansas legislative records. If no such legislation is passed by the specified date, or if only partial restrictions are enacted, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only concerns the passage of the bill in the Senate, not its final enactment into law.

question.title: Will BYD's quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if BYD reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (1) The U.S. government resumes consideration of liquefied natural gas export projects, and (2) BYD's quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (1) The U.S. federal government officially resumes the consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG). This resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal. The resumption should involve the active processing or review of LNG export project applications by relevant federal agencies. (2) BYD reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. This increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or Wall Street Journal. If either condition is not met by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will the FTC announce completion of a major pricing practices investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into pricing practices that use personal data to set prices based on individual shopper characteristics. The investigation must involve at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FTC does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024 and will the FTC complete a major pricing practices investigation by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
   2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
   3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   The question will resolve as NO if:
   1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
   2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
   3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.
   Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into pricing practices that use personal data to set prices based on individual shopper characteristics. The investigation must involve at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FTC does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

For this combined question to resolve as YES, both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied within their respective timeframes.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

question.title: Will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for Cracker Jack in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceeds 5.5% by August 2024 (b) PepsiCo reports increased North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 
(a) At any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. The rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.
(b) By July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications.
If either of these conditions is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Missouri remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Missouri officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement remains in place, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Pennsylvania conducts a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024 and (b) Missouri removes the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
   2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
   3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the state of Missouri officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement remains in place, the question resolves as NO.

If both (a) and (b) occur by their respective dates, this question resolves as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Spotify announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Spotify officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 2% workforce reduction. If no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if Spotify only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 2% reduction without announcing new cuts, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Reserve Bank of India and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the repo rate, which is the RBI's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) Spotify announces additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 2%, and (2) The Reserve Bank of India announces a reduction in its key interest rate?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (1) Spotify officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% of its workforce. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 2% workforce reduction. (2) The Reserve Bank of India publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate. The announcement must be officially made by the Reserve Bank of India and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the repo rate, which is the RBI's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If either of these announcements is not made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will GNC Holdings emerge from bankruptcy by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, GNC Holdings officially emerges from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings. The emergence must be confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) or through official company statements or court documents. The emergence should involve a court-approved reorganization plan that allows GNC Holdings to continue operations with a restructured financial position. If GNC Holdings remains in bankruptcy proceedings, is liquidated, or fails to emerge from bankruptcy by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Bank of England announces an interest rate cut by August 2024 (b) GNC Holdings emerges from bankruptcy by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy. (b) GNC Holdings officially emerges from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings by July 31, 2024. The emergence must be confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) or through official company statements or court documents. The emergence should involve a court-approved reorganization plan that allows GNC Holdings to continue operations with a restructured financial position. If GNC Holdings remains in bankruptcy proceedings, is liquidated, or fails to emerge from bankruptcy by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. If both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Italian economy avoids a recession, and (b) The Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5%?
question.body: (a) The Italian economy avoids a recession by July 31, 2024, meaning it does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) The Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure, typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index (PCE), shows a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. This increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources, such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC.

question.title: Will France appoint a new President by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a new President is officially appointed in France. The appointment must be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the purpose of this question, a 'new' President refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. If no new President is appointed by the resolution date, or if the current President as of October 1, 2023, remains in office, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Bank of England's base rate remain at or above 5.00% in August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England's base rate is reported to be at or above 5.00% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Guardian). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 5.00% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) France appoints a new President by August 2024, and (b) the Bank of England's base rate remains at or above 5.00% in August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, a new President is officially appointed in France. The appointment must be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). A 'new' President refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. (b) The Bank of England's base rate is reported to be at or above 5.00% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Guardian). If both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Apple finalize a union contract with store employees in Ohio by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Ohio. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States. If no such finalization and signing of the contract occurs by the specified date, or if the contract is still in a tentative or non-finalized state, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024, and (b) Apple finalizes a union contract with store employees in Ohio by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur:

(a) By August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:
   1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
   2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
   3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Ohio. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States.

If either (a) or (b) does not occur by the specified dates, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Sergey Brin on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Sergey Brin must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United States implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles. The implementation must be confirmed by official U.S. government announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). The tariff must be specifically targeted at electric vehicles manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all vehicles. If no such tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X, and (b) the United States implements a significant tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

1. Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (formerly known as Twitter). For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:
   - The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
   - Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
   - Sergey Brin must be the interviewee.
   - The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
   - The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
   - At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

2. The United States officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles. The implementation must be confirmed by official U.S. government announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). The tariff must be specifically targeted at electric vehicles manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all vehicles.

If both of these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met by this date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current Nipah virus outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing Nipah virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the mpox outbreak in the Central African Republic be declared over by July 2024?

The outbreak referred to is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. (2) The mpox outbreak in the Central African Republic is officially declared over by the country's health authorities or the World Health Organization (WHO) by July 31, 2024. The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN). If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the outbreak is still ongoing, this part will resolve as NO. The overall question will resolve as YES only if both parts resolve as YES.

question.title: Will India eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?

Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such policy is introduced or implemented by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are taken, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will India's central bank's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?

question.title: Will Uber lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Uber has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Uber confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) India's central bank's preferred inflation measure will show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5%, and (b) Uber will lay off at least 1,800 employees?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) India's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Reserve Bank of India or a relevant Indian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If no such increase is reported during this period, this part of the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame. (b) Uber confirms the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Uber confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, this part of the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution. Only if both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied by July 31, 2024, will this question resolve as YES.

question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Satya Nadella on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Satya Nadella on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Satya Nadella must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Nvidia announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Nvidia officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The measures announced should be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Nvidia's AI systems. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced measures do not specifically target AI-related electricity consumption, the question resolves as NO.

question.body:

   If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, this part resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, this part resolves as NO.

(b) Nvidia officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The measures announced should be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Nvidia's AI systems. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced measures do not specifically target AI-related electricity consumption, this part resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES if both parts (a) and (b) resolve as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Samsung only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. question.title: Will the Mexican economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (1) the Mexican economy avoids a recession and (2) Sony Corporation resolves a major workers' strike?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

1. The Mexican economy does not enter a recession. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

2. Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. The strike must involve at least 1,000 participants and last for at least one week. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Astellas allow generic production of its prostate cancer drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Astellas officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its prostate cancer drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Astellas continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will AstraZeneca allow generic production of its cancer treatment drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, AstraZeneca officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its cancer treatment drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. question.title: Will both Astellas and AstraZeneca allow generic production of their respective cancer drugs by July 2024?

If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if AstraZeneca continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The European Central Bank announces an interest rate cut, and (b) Hyundai Motor Company resolves a major workers' strike?
question.body:

If either of these events does not occur by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the S&P 500 index reach or exceed 4,800 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points. The 4,800 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,800 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,800 points.

question.title: Will Shopify lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Shopify has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Shopify confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points by August 2024, and (b) Shopify lays off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) The S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points at any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. Intraday highs are considered valid for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,800 points.

(b) Shopify confirms the layoff of at least 1,800 employees by July 31, 2024, as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023.

If either condition (a) or (b) is not met, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Philippine government enforce a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines. The enforcement must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and involve official government actions leading to the cessation of operations for a significant number of these trading platforms. 'Significant' in this context means at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must be a result of government policy or directive, not due to voluntary closures or economic factors. If no such enforcement meeting these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the International Monetary Fund announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the International Monetary Fund officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Philippine government enforces a shutdown of at least 50% of Chinese-run online trading platforms, and (b) The IMF announces new funding commitments totaling over $400 million?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) There are confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines. The enforcement must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and involve official government actions leading to the cessation of operations for a significant number of these trading platforms. 'Significant' means at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must be a result of government policy or directive, not due to voluntary closures or economic factors. (b) The International Monetary Fund officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If both conditions are not met by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's climate disclosure rule be reinstated by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's rule on climate disclosures, previously blocked by a court decision, is reinstated. The reinstatement must be confirmed by official court documents or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The reinstatement could occur through a successful appeal, a reversal of the court's decision, or any other legal mechanism that results in the rule taking effect. If the rule remains blocked or is not reinstated by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the NASDAQ Composite index reach or exceed 15,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the NASDAQ Composite index reaches or exceeds 15,000 points. If the index does not reach 15,000 points during this period, this part resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 15,000 points. If both conditions are met, the combined question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will California conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of California.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Oregon hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Oregon officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Oregon state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will both California and Oregon conduct referendums on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, both California and Oregon conduct public referendums specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in their respective states. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met for each state:

For California:
1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of California.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

For Oregon:
1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Oregon state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if either California or Oregon does not conduct such a referendum by August 31, 2024, or if the referendums do not meet the specified criteria.

question.title: Will the FDA approve MDMA as a therapy for PTSD by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially approves MDMA (3,4-Methylenedioxymethamphetamine) for use as a therapy for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the approval must be confirmed through an official announcement from the FDA and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The approval must specifically be for the use of MDMA in treating PTSD, not for any other condition or use. If no such approval is granted by the resolution date, or if the FDA explicitly rejects or delays the approval beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Mexican authorities officially declare the dismantling of the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Mexican authorities (such as federal law enforcement agencies or high-ranking government officials) make an official public declaration stating that the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized as a criminal organization. The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or major Mexican news sources). The declaration should indicate a significant disruption to the cartel's leadership structure, operations, or ability to function as a cohesive criminal entity. Mere arrests of individual members or partial disruptions to the cartel's activities do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such official declaration meeting these criteria is made by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will the FDA approve MDMA as a therapy for PTSD by August 2024? (b) Will Mexican authorities officially declare the dismantling of the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially approves MDMA (3,4-Methylenedioxymethamphetamine) for use as a therapy for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by August 31, 2024. The approval must be confirmed through an official announcement from the FDA and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The approval must specifically be for the use of MDMA in treating PTSD, not for any other condition or use. If no such approval is granted by the resolution date, or if the FDA explicitly rejects or delays the approval beyond August 31, 2024, this condition will not be met. (2) Mexican authorities (such as federal law enforcement agencies or high-ranking government officials) make an official public declaration by July 31, 2024, stating that the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized as a criminal organization. The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or major Mexican news sources). The declaration should indicate a significant disruption to the cartel's leadership structure, operations, or ability to function as a cohesive criminal entity. Mere arrests of individual members or partial disruptions to the cartel's activities do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such official declaration meeting these criteria is made by July 31, 2024, this condition will not be met. Only if both conditions are satisfied will this question resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Israel announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Israel officially announces a decrease in its interest rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Israel or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Israel members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will large protests occur in the United Kingdom in response to healthcare funding cuts by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in the United Kingdom specifically in response to the government's decision to cut healthcare funding. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across the United Kingdom. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of healthcare funding cuts. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the funding cuts are rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) the Central Bank of Israel announces an interest rate cut, and (b) large protests occur in the UK in response to healthcare funding cuts?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Israel officially announces a decrease in its interest rate, confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Israel or reported by at least two major financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Israel members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, this part of the question resolves as NO. (b) There are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera of large protests in the United Kingdom specifically in response to the government's decision to cut healthcare funding. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across the United Kingdom. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of healthcare funding cuts. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the funding cuts are rescinded before causing such protests, this part of the question resolves as NO. The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

question.title: Will Nevada maintain its $11 per hour minimum wage for fast food workers through July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, as of July 31, 2024, the minimum wage for fast food workers in Nevada remains at $11 per hour or higher. question.title: Will the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does not enter a recession. question.title: Will the German economy avoid a recession by July 2024?

question.title: Will Sara Lee issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?

4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio be canceled by August 2024?

question.body:

question.title: Will Nigeria maintain its ban on cryptocurrency transactions through August, 2024?

question.body:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the median Canadian home price reach a new record high by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the median price of existing homes sold in Canada reaches a new record high, surpassing any previous monthly median price on record. The record must be confirmed by data from the Canadian Real Estate Association or other widely recognized real estate data providers such as Royal LePage or RE/MAX. The median price refers to the middle price in the range of home prices sold, where half of the homes sold for more and half sold for less. If no new record high is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported median price does not exceed the current record, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question focuses on the nominal price, not adjusted for inflation.

question.title: Will Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024 and will Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES only if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

(a) Pennsylvania is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within Pennsylvania.

(b) Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. The strike must involve a substantial number of Nissan workers (at least 1,000 participants) and last for at least one week. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. and the involved union, and be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If either of these conditions is not met by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Texas hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Texas officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on abortion rights. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address abortion rights, either proposing to enshrine protections or to restrict/ban abortion. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on abortion does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Teamsters Union endorse a candidate for the 2024 US presidential election by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Teamsters Union publicly endorses a candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. The endorsement must be confirmed through official Teamsters Union statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The endorsement must clearly indicate support for a specific candidate in the 2024 presidential race. If no such endorsement is made or publicly announced by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider hypothetical or speculative endorsements; only official, public endorsements will be considered for resolution.
