The endorsement must clearly indicate support for a specific candidate in the 2024 presidential race. If no such endorsement is made or publicly announced by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. The combined question resolves as YES if and only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will Google lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?

The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Google confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

question.title: Will the South African Reserve Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the South African Reserve Bank officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual SARB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Shanghai Composite index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Shanghai Composite index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Shanghai Stock Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

question.title: Will 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' be the highest-grossing R-rated movie by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' remains the highest-grossing R-rated movie worldwide, not accounting for inflation, as of August 31, 2024. If any other R-rated movie surpasses its earnings by this date, or if 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' loses its top position at any point before the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, only theatrical releases are considered, excluding any streaming or VOD revenues.

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Hillshire Farm issue a recall of sausage products due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Hillshire Farm officially announces a recall of any of its sausage products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

2. A press release from Hillshire Farm
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Hillshire Farm recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. Note that this question is about the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) China's central bank's preferred inflation measure shows a monthly increase exceeding 0.5%, and (b) Samsung announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) China's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the People's Bank of China or a relevant Chinese government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, South China Morning Post). (b) Samsung publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If either condition is not met by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Green Acres Co. be officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Green Acres Co. is officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak that is different from any previously reported outbreaks. The link must be confirmed by U.S. federal health officials (such as the CDC or FDA) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The outbreak must be traced back to products from Green Acres Co. and must have occurred after October 1, 2023. If no such new outbreak is linked to Green Acres Co. by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the FDA issue a recall for ground basil products due to lead contamination by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially issues a recall for any ground basil products due to lead contamination. The recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to remove their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such recall is issued by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Green Acres Co. is officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak and (b) the FDA issues a recall for ground basil products due to lead contamination?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur by July 31, 2024: (a) Green Acres Co. is officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak that is different from any previously reported outbreaks, confirmed by U.S. federal health officials (such as the CDC or FDA) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The outbreak must be traced back to products from Green Acres Co. and must have occurred after October 1, 2023. (b) The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially issues a recall for any ground basil products due to lead contamination, confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to remove their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution. If either or both of these events do not occur by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Nigeria's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Bayer allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Bayer officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Bayer continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nigeria's Senate passes a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024, and (b) Bayer allows generic production of its cardiovascular drug by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

   - The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   - The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Bayer officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers).

If both conditions (a) and (b) are met, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations are spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention TikTok's AI and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Chinese battery company's factory project in Michigan be canceled by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the Chinese lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a $2.36 billion factory in Big Rapids, Michigan has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Michigan, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations will be reported for spreading election misinformation and (b) the Chinese battery company's factory project in Michigan will be canceled?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) There are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations are spreading election misinformation. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention TikTok's AI and its role in spreading election misinformation. (b) It is confirmed that the Chinese lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a $2.36 billion factory in Big Rapids, Michigan has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Michigan, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If both conditions are not met by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Colorado's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Colorado's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Colorado state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Will Rhode Island maintain its red flag law through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, Rhode Island continues to enforce a red flag law as part of its gun safety laws. The resolution will be based on official state regulations or announcements from Rhode Island's government, confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Rhode Island news outlets). If the law is repealed or significantly altered by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Colorado's near-total abortion ban is declared constitutional, and (b) Rhode Island maintains its red flag law?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) A Colorado state court confirms the constitutionality of Colorado's near-total abortion ban, with reports from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). The ban refers to the law blocked and pending assessment as of October 1, 2023. (b) Rhode Island continues to enforce a red flag law as part of its gun safety laws, based on official state regulations or announcements from Rhode Island's government, confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Rhode Island news outlets). If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Spain eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Spanish government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such policy is introduced or implemented by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are taken, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United States report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either corn or soybeans) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Spain eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024 AND will the United States report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur: (1) By July 31, 2024, the Spanish government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. (2) By August 31, 2024, the United States officially reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). The question resolves as NO if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Indonesia announce a new monetary easing policy by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces a new monetary easing policy. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Indonesia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Indonesia. The announcement should explicitly describe the new monetary easing policy. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Indonesia maintains the current policy stance, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) the Central Bank of Indonesia announces a new monetary easing policy and (b) the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points?
question.body:
(a) The Central Bank of Indonesia must officially announce a new monetary easing policy by August 31, 2024. This announcement should come from an official Central Bank of Indonesia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Indonesia, and explicitly describe the new monetary easing policy. It must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Indonesia maintains the current policy stance, this condition resolves as NO.

(b) The Singapore Straits Times Index must reach or exceed 4,000 points at any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. Intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points. If the index does not reach 4,000 points during this period, this condition resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as described.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current West Nile virus outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing West Nile virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Land O'Frost issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The World Health Organization declares the current West Nile virus outbreak over, and (b) Land O'Frost issues a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following events occur by August 31, 2024:

(a) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing West Nile virus outbreak over. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, this part will resolve as NO.

The overall question will resolve as YES only if both parts (a) and (b) resolve as YES by the specified date.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage in the US fall below 5.0% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 5.0% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not fall below 5.0% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, the question will resolve as NO. For clarity, a rate of exactly 5.0% will not be considered as falling below 5.0%.

question.title: Will Jerome Powell remain as Federal Reserve Chair through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Jerome Powell is still serving as the Chair of the Federal Reserve on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Federal Reserve announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Chair by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Chair appointments will not be considered as Powell remaining in the position.

Confirmation must come from official Federal Reserve announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Chair by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the condition is not met. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Chair appointments will not be considered as Powell remaining in the position. The question resolves as NO if either or both conditions are not met.

question.title: Will Missouri hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Missouri officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Missouri state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Missouri-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Missouri and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the American Federation of Teachers (AFT) publicly endorses a candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. The endorsement must clearly indicate support for a specific candidate in the 2024 presidential race. If no such endorsement is made or publicly announced by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider hypothetical or speculative endorsements; only official, public endorsements will be considered for resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Missouri holds a referendum on abortion rights and (b) the American Federation of Teachers endorses a candidate for the 2024 US presidential election?

Only if both events occur as described will the combined question resolve as YES.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Miami by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Miami, Florida. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Miami rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will New Jersey conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?

2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Kamala Harris announces her running mate at a rally in Miami and (b) New Jersey conducts a referendum on abortion rights?

If either event does not occur by the end of August 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a mental health support requirement by July 2024?

question.title: Will Iowa's 6-week abortion ban be overturned by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Iowa's law banning most abortions after approximately six weeks of pregnancy is either repealed by the state legislature or invalidated by a court ruling. The repeal or invalidation must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the law remains in effect as of July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'overturned' means the law is no longer enforceable in its current form, either through legislative action or judicial decision.

question.title: Will Colorado's abortion law allowing procedures up to 22 weeks remain unchanged by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Colorado's current abortion law permitting abortions up to 22 weeks remains in effect without any changes. The status of the law must be confirmed by official state legislative records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Colorado newspapers). If the law is modified, replaced, or overturned by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. This includes any changes that either restrict or expand the current 22-week limit.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Iowa's 6-week abortion ban is overturned by July 2024 AND (b) Colorado's abortion law allowing procedures up to 22 weeks remains unchanged by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By July 31, 2024, Iowa's law banning most abortions after approximately six weeks of pregnancy is either repealed by the state legislature or invalidated by a court ruling. The repeal or invalidation must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. For the purpose of this question, 'overturned' means the law is no longer enforceable in its current form, either through legislative action or judicial decision. AND (2) By August 31, 2024, Colorado's current abortion law permitting abortions up to 22 weeks remains in effect without any changes. The status of the law must be confirmed by official state legislative records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Colorado newspapers). If both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will a major social media platform be reported for spreading election misinformation through its AI systems by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major social media platform is spreading election misinformation through its AI systems. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the platform and its AI systems' role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Nicolas Maduro publicly condemn the attack on Maria Corina Machado's headquarters by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro makes a public statement specifically condemning the attack on Maria Corina Machado's headquarters that occurred in 2023. The statement must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or similar). The condemnation must be explicit and unambiguous, directly addressing the attack on Machado's headquarters. If no such condemnation is made by the resolution date, or if the condemnation is vague or does not specifically mention the attack on Machado's headquarters, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (1) There are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major social media platform is spreading election misinformation through its AI systems. question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Oracle announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Oracle officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The measures announced should be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Oracle's AI systems. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced measures do not specifically target AI-related electricity consumption, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Reserve Bank of India announces an interest rate cut, and (b) Oracle announces measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur by July 31, 2024: (a) The Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate, confirmed through official statements or reported by at least two major financial news sources. The decision must be made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. (b) Oracle officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations, through official company channels or reported by at least two major news outlets. The measures must be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Oracle's AI systems. If either or both of these announcements are not made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will President Biden deliver a speech at a National Education Association event in Illinois by July 2024?

question.title: Will California receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of California is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within California. If the total amount of such grants awarded to California does not exceed $300 million by the specified date, or if there is insufficient evidence to confirm such an award, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) President Biden delivers a speech at a National Education Association event in Illinois, and (b) California receives over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) President Joe Biden delivers a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event held in Illinois, confirmed by official White House announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. (b) The state of California is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects, with confirmation from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or reports by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within California. If either condition is not met by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will a major hospital system in the Northeast US cancel over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in the Northeast United States, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple Northeastern states. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is $300 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A major hospital system in the Northeast US cancels over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024, and (b) Hyundai Motor Company resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES only if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in the Northeast United States, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, cancels more than $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple Northeastern states. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is $300 million or less, this condition is not met.

(b) Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid, the strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants), last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union. Additionally, the resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this condition is not met.

The question resolves as NO if either or both conditions are not met.

question.title: Will Virginia maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: Will IBM lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?

Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If IBM confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

question.title: Will U.S. previously occupied home sales show a decline for two consecutive months by July 2024?

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 2024?

question.title: Will the Bahraini health ministry confirm more than one case of polio in Manama by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Bahraini health ministry officially confirms more than one case of polio in Manama. For the purpose of this question:

1. Confirmation must come from official Bahraini health ministry reports or statements.
2. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
3. The cases must be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023.
4. Only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered.
5. The type of polio (wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) does not matter for this question.

If no additional cases beyond the first are confirmed by the specified date, or if only one case in total is confirmed, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Brazil's monthly job growth fall below 50,000 in any single month by July 2024?

The question will resolve as NO if either:
(a) The South Korean economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.
(b) The WHO does not make the required declaration by August 31, 2024, or makes a declaration about Lassa fever that does not specifically address the Nigerian outbreak, or maintains or escalates the emergency status of the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current bird flu outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing bird flu outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points, and (b) The World Health Organization declares the current bird flu outbreak over?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points at any time between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. This includes intraday highs, based on official reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. (b) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing bird flu outbreak over by August 31, 2024, as confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC. If either condition is not met, this question will resolve as NO.
